title: The A.I. Boom Has Found Another Gear. Why Can’t People Shake Their Worries?
summary: It is a time of superlatives in the tech industry, with historic profits, stock prices and deal prices. It’s enough to make some people very nervous.

title: Anxiety Over A.I. Spending Returns to Global Markets
summary: A sharp reversal in Asian and European stocks, after a rally fueled by Nvidia’s strong earnings, underscores how fears of an A.I. bubble are driving broad market swings.

title: Mamdani at the White House, and the Coast Guard’s New Policy on Swastikas and Nooses
summary: Plus, your Friday news quiz.

title: Congressional Republicans Begin to Look Beyond Trump
summary: Election defeats earlier this month and the approach of 2026 have G.O.P. lawmakers cautiously asserting themselves.

title: Trump and Mamdani Are Meeting for the First Time. Will They Play Nice?
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the mayor-elect of New York City, will go to the White House on Friday. The stakes are high for the city.

title: Zelensky Says Ukraine Ready to ‘Honestly’ Engage With U.S. Peace Plan
summary: The proposal, which the White House confirmed on Thursday without providing details, echoes many long-held Russian demands.

title: Trump’s All-but-Forgotten Border Wall Reaches an Angry Laredo, Texas
summary: Once the symbol of the president’s immigration policies, the wall has been eclipsed by his deportation efforts, but with $46.5 billion from Congress, construction is ramping up on the Rio Grande.

title: After Syria’s 14-Year Civil War, a Search for Victims Leads to Mass Graves
summary: More than 100,000 people disappeared during the 13-year civil war. To bring closure to some of their families, the new government faces the challenging task of exhuming remains from scores of burial sites.

title: Republicans’ Redistricting Push Is at Risk of Backfiring
summary: A series of setbacks for the G.O.P. leaves an unlikely opening for Democrats to narrowly win this year’s redistricting wars.

title: Japan’s Leader Gets Off to Rocky Start With China
summary: Facing reprisals from Beijing for a remark over Taiwan, Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi must walk a fine line to prevent escalating the dispute without looking weak at home.

title: Adrien Nunez, the Brooklyn Basketball Star Who Became a Country Music Heartthrob
summary: As a boy in Brooklyn, Adrien Nunez dreamed of playing in the N.B.A. He got close, but it turns out he had a gift for singing at the top of his lungs in his car.

title: Researcher’s Smuggling Arrest Casts Light on Dispute Over Chinese Students
summary: As some lawmakers press U.S. universities to curtail ties with China, a postdoctoral student’s prosecution raises questions about how big the danger actually is.

title: Fine Chocolate in Brazil, Home of the Cacao Bean
summary: A new generation of craft chocolatiers in Brazil is making bars with “identity.” They’re helping to sustain the forest, too.

title: Trump Promised Lower Prices. His Policies Are Raising Them.
summary: From the day he took the oath of office, the president has pursued policies that are making life in America less affordable.

title: What Trump’s Immigration Policies Are Doing to People Here Legally
summary: Something new is happening in the breadth and ferocity of efforts to change the makeup of this country.

title: Is President Trump’s Power Over the Republican Party Waning?
summary: Some members of the party are defying him.

title: ‘I’ll Go When You Go,’ Jimmy Kimmel Tells Trump
summary: “Let’s ride off into the sunset together like Butch Cassidy and the Suntan Kid,” Kimmel said after the president demanded (again) that ABC take him off the air.

title: Representative Eric Swalwell Will Run for California Governor
summary: Representative Eric Swalwell, a Democrat, is likely to emphasize his history of fighting President Trump, an approach that many Democratic voters say they want their elected officials to take.

title: U.S. Manufacturers to Benefit as GE Appliances Shifts Production
summary: The company, now owned by a Chinese conglomerate, is investing $150 million in 19 American suppliers across 10 states.

title: Mexico Wins Miss Universe Pageant Marred by Scandal
summary: Fátima Bosch was crowned in Thailand on Friday. The competition got off to a rocky start this month when she briefly walked out after being scolded by an organizer.

title: Frida Kahlo Portrait Sells for $55 Million, Setting Her Auction Record
summary: The surrealistic self-portrait was made in 1940, a turbulent year in the Mexican artist’s life as her health and marriage deteriorated.
